question_text:
Question 51
In a steam power plant based on Rankine cycle, steam is initially expanded in a
 
high-pressure turbine. The 
steam is then reheated in a reheater and finally expanded
 
in a low-pressure turbine. The expansion work 
in the high-pressure turbine is
 
400 kJ/kg and in the low-pressure turbine is 850 kJ/kg, whereas the pump

GATE 2022 
 [Forenoon Session]
Mechanical Engineering
PAGE
54

work
 
is 15 kJ/kg. If the cycle efficiency is 32%, the heat rejected in the condenser
 
is ________ kJ/kg 
(round off to 2 decimal places).
